elements.title: Hannibal von Degenfeld (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hannibal von Degenfeld (pictured) played the leading role in establishing the Bavarian Army in 1682, before leading it to the Battle of Vienna a year later?

elements.title: a documentary on assisted suicide (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a reviewer did not expect a documentary on assisted suicide to be so funny?

elements.title: Sunny Choi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while Sunny Choi and Logan Edra represent their country at the Olympics in breakdancing, Afghan breakdancer Manizha Talash competes as a member of the IOC Refugee Olympic Team?

elements.title: 2025 Philippine general election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2025 Philippine general election is set to be the first to be held under a new voting system provider after the previous one was disqualified over bribery allegations?

elements.title: Piano Quintet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Piano Quintet by Dmitri Shostakovich has been called "the most expensive piece of chamber music ever composed"?

elements.title: Mercy Gilbert Medical Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that workers building Mercy Gilbert Medical Center plowed over alfalfa fields and chased off sheep during construction?

elements.title: Ahhotep I (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the discovery of a coffin belonging to Ahhotep I, which had been reused to bury a high priest, ignited a debate among scholars over the true number of Egyptian queens named Ahhotep?

elements.title: 2024 Sugar Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Washington's participation in the 2024 Sugar Bowl marked the first appearance of any Pac-12 Conference team in the Sugar Bowl?

elements.title: John H. Bryant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British physician John H. Bryant gave the first description of a blue scrotum caused by a ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm?
